parameters.name: SymId
parameters.description: Name of the geometric tolerance symbol formatted as: < LibraryName-SymbolName > where LibraryName and SymbolName are in the SOLIDWORKS text file C:\ProgramData\SolidWorks\SolidWorks 20 nn \ lang \ english\gtol.sym . NOTE : You must include the right- and left-angle brackets and separate LibraryName and SymbolName with a hyphen; for example, <MOD-DEG>.

title: IEnvironment.GetSymCircles
description: Gets an array that defines all circles in the geometric tolerance symbol.

parameters.name: SymId
parameters.description: Name of the geometric tolerance symbol formatted as: < LibraryName-SymbolName > where LibraryName and SymbolName are in the SOLIDWORKS text file C:\ProgramData\SolidWorks\SolidWorks 20 nn \ lang \ english\gtol.sym . NOTE : You must include the right- and left-angle brackets and separate LibraryName and SymbolName with a hyphen; for example, <MOD-DEG>.

remarks:
Each circle in the geometric tolerance symbol is defined by its radius and center point. The size of the array returned is based on the number of circles within this symbol. You can determine this number using the return value circle count from
IEnvironment::GetSymEdgeCounts
.
The format of return value is the following array of doubles (in this example, for the
i
th circle):
retval[4 * i] = radius
retval[4 * i + 1] = x coordinate of center point
retval[4 * i + 2] = y coordinate of center point
retval[4 * i + 3] = z coordinate of center point
